comments:
How to reproduce the bug:
1. Go to Run->Run... or Run->Debug...
2. Select one Java Application and click on the JRE configuration panel.
3. Select another Java Application.
4. Select the previous Java Application and click on the JRE configuration panel again.
An error meesage will pop up and exceptions are logged in the .metadata/.log file.  The JRE panel becomes empty and cannot be configured any more.

Exceptions in the log:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.launching 2 103 2007-12-04 15:28:27.980
!MESSAGE VM not fully specified in launch configuration Client-en - missing VM name. Reverting to default VM.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.launching 2 103 2007-12-04 15:28:27.980
!MESSAGE VM not fully specified in launch configuration Client-en - missing VM name. Reverting to default VM.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.launching 2 103 2007-12-04 15:28:27.980

!STACK 0

Do you know if the problem happens on 3.3 or latest 3.4 build?
I tried Eclipse 3.3 and got the same exception in the log.
I can't make this happen in 3.3 or 3.4. Can you provide example launch configs that make this happen?
